Class OrLogicBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • LogicBlock
      • OrLogicBlock

  • public class OrLogicBlock
extends LogicBlock
    An OrLogicBlock is a LogicBlock that has an output value of true when the output value of one or more LogicBlock objects in prevBlocks is true. The update methods of the next blocks are only called if the LogicBlock that called update on this OrLogicBlock had an output value of true or if the output value of this block is changing from true to false.
    Author:
    Shawn Koop

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class LogicBlock

        nextBlocks, prevBlocks

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void update(boolean callerOutput)
      The output value of this OrLogicBlock is set to true if callerOutput is true.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrLogicBlock

        public OrLogicBlock()

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(boolean callerOutput)
        The output value of this OrLogicBlock is set to true if callerOutput is true. If callerOutput is false all of the prevBlocks are checked. If none of their output values are true, the output value of this OrLogicBlock is set to false.

        The update methods of the next blocks are called if callerOutput is true or if the output value of this OrLogicBlock is changing from true to false.

        Specified by:
        update in class LogicBlock
        Parameters:
        callerOutput - The output value of the LogicBlock that called update on this LogicBlock.
